Documentation.name: UML Profile for Mapping Conceptual Models to Application Schemas
Documentation.notes: Provides informative stereotypes to assist in the separation of concerns between conceptual common ground and multiple implementations (Application Schemas) developed according to the ISO19109 rules. Implemented for Enterprise Architect tool by Rob Atkinson, Social Change Online and Simon Cox, CSIRO Exploration and Mining.

Stereotype.name: Domain Model
Stereotype.notes: Root of model describing a Domain. Contains placeholders for conceptual elements that may have multiple representations in one or more Application Schemas.

Tag.name: owner
Tag.description: Party responsible for maintenance of this package

Stereotype.name: ConceptualFeature
Stereotype.notes: Class represents a common agreement that an object exists - i.e. carries identity and characteristic properties. Generically, all ConceptualFeatures have an extensible set of typed properties, whose name is bound to an external dictionary. Where explicit relationships depend on particular properties, these properties can be promoted to named properties.

Stereotype.name: ControlledVocabulary
Stereotype.notes: Class represents a dictionary, with some level of ontological richness appropriate to the domain.

Stereotype.name: profileOf
Stereotype.notes: realizing class constrains implementation of one or more properties of realized class.

Stereotype.name: implementsViewOf
Stereotype.notes: realizing class provides implementable view of conceptual class.
